body:
Problem:
1.Info window was displayed even with insufficient space.
2.Tab characters counted as single cells.

Solution:
1. Hide window when space < 10 columns. Will be configurable
   via completepopup width option in the future.
2. Use win_linetabsize replace mb_string2cells.

comment_data.body:
Setting `curwin` directly seems dubious. `curwin` after `win_close` in `pum_adjust_info_position` _should_ be `curwin_save` anyhow (makes this a no-op), but if that's somehow false then this is bugprone. (`curbuf` and other globals may remain out-of-sync)

Maybe use `win_enter`? (I'll assume `win_valid` isn't needed here as autocmds are blocked for popups... ðŸ˜‡)

```suggestion
              win_enter(curwin_save, false);
```

```
set completeopt+=popup,menuone nolist
setlocal tabstop=1
startinsert
```
I assume this tabstop is you want set in preview buffer not main buffer tight ?

Edit: I know what is missing .ðŸ˜®â€ðŸ’¨

```suggestion
```

I don't think it's worth only copying `&ts`; tab padding may also be affected by `&vts` (plus `&list` and `&lcs`).  
Also this code is only used by `nvim__complete_set`, so this change won't affect the info popup in the usual case. (`pum_set_selected`)

I think it's OK to not copy anything and just leave the buffer to use the global values from when it's created.

```suggestion
        eq(21, api.nvim_win_get_width(info.preview_winid))
```

After making the other change, this should be 21. (default of `&ts=8` aligns the end of the 2nd tab to column 16)

(Note that expecting 12 here would've also passed with the prior buggy behaviour of `linetabsize_str` in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/commit/3ce9f63c498f4d5d11f3d67baa237fab46c52f5c, so maybe also add a screen test here to ensure the text isn't wrapped?)
